column99: Det Kongelige Teater søger maskører-frisører-sminkører/The Royal Danish Theatre is looking for make-up artists-hairstylists
column100: FOR ENGLISH SEE BELOW     Maskør- og Parykafdelingen øger bemandingen i henhold til teatrets strategi, og vi søger derfor 3 nye, dygtige medarbejdere pr. 1. august 2022.   Maskørafdelingen har 18 ansatte fordelt på vores tre kunstarter; opera, skuespil og ballet. Du vil som udgangspunkt skulle arbejde med en kunstart ad gangen men kan forvente at skulle arbejde på tværs af husene.   Maskørerne arbejder med alt vedrørende hår og maskering i forbindelse med klargøring og afvikling af prøver og teatrets forestillinger.     Om dig  Vi forventer, at du er uddannet maskør, frisør eller sminkør, gerne inden for flere af disse fagområder, og at du således har betydelige kompetencer inden for special effects, sminkør-, frisør- og parykfaget, og at du har arbejdet med teaterproduktioner tidligere, gerne inden for flere kunstarter.   Du udviser selvstændighed og griber fleksibelt samt løsningsorienteret dine opgaver og er engageret, ansvarsbevidst og serviceminded.   Du har en konstruktiv og kreativ tilgang til dine opgaver.   Som projektansvarlig for dine produktioner er du medansvarlig for at få det gode samarbejde på tværs af afdelinger til at lykkes, og du er i høj grad en holdspiller som er god til at indgå i relationer med mange forskellige mennesker.   Vi lægger desuden vægt på, at du:     har betydelig erfaring primært fra teaterverdenen   er vant til at arbejde med parykker, herunder påsætning, frisering og vedligeholdelse   har erfaring inden for større og mindre sminkeopgaver, herunder karaktersminke.       Vi tilbyder dig  Det Kongelige Teater er en spændende arbejdsplads med mulighed for stor personlig og faglig udvikling. Vi producerer ca. 65 forestillinger om året, som giver dig mulighed for at arbejde bredt med dit håndværk. Du vil foruden nærmeste leder få 18 kollegaer, som vægter det gode samarbejde og faglig sparring højt i en omskiftelig hverdag.   Stillingerne er fastansættelser på 37 timer ugentlig. Weekend- og aftenarbejde er en naturlig del af arbejdet.   Løn- og ansættelsesvilkår følger fællesoverenskomsten mellem Finansministeriet og OAO samt organisationsaftale for Det Kongelige Teaters teaterteknikere.     Sådan søger du  Søg stillingerne ved at klikke på "Søg stillingen" til højre i annoncen senest den 15. maj 2022 og vedlæg cv, evt. anbefalinger og eksamensbevis. Inkluder også gerne billeder af dit tidligere arbejde.   Send din ansøgning allerede nu, for vi holder løbende ansættelsessamtaler.   Alle interesserede uanset personlig baggrund opfordres til at søge stillingerne.     Vil du vide mere?  Du er velkommen til at kontakte afdelingsleder Nina Brødegaard Resch på e-mail  nres@kglteater.dk , hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingerne.   Du kan læse mere om Det Kongelige Teater på  https://kglteater.dk/     The Royal Danish Theatre is looking for make-up artists/hairstylists.   The Royal Danish Theatre's make-up and wig department is increasing its staff and is therefore looking for 3 qualified employees to start August 1st.   We are a team of 18 make-up artists/hairstylists spread across the Royal Danish Theatre's three divisions: opera, playhouse and ballet. As a member of the make-up department, you will primarily be assigned to one of the three houses but should be prepared to be working in the other two houses as well.     Our job is to design and create the looks of the characters for the plays by producing anything to do with hair, make-up or special effects. This includes working with wigs, creating hairstyles both modern and historical, cutting hair, making wigs, hairpieces, beards, and special effects, applying make-up, making masks, and creating characters. As project managers for productions, we are jointly responsible for the success of good collaboration between departments. The documentation of our work is also part of our responsibilities.  In collaboration with the artistic team, we design and realise the necessary tasks. This includes being on duty for rehearsals and performances.     Your qualifications       You have completed training as a make-up artist or hairstylist, preferably both   You have excellent skills in the areas of make-up, hairdressing, wig handling (styling, application, care), special effects, and wig production.   You have already gained experience in theatre/ballet/opera.   You have experience applying make-up on artists (beauty & character make-up)   You enjoy working in a team and are flexible and able to work under pressure.   You also have a special sensitivity for artistic issues and creative processes.   You are willing to work the usual hours of a make-up artist as a matter of course.   Good English language skills complete your profile.       We offer  The Royal Danish Theatre is an exciting place to work with the opportunity for great personal and professional development. We produce around 65 shows a year, which gives you the opportunity to apply your craft on a broad basis. In addition to your direct supervisor, you will have 18 colleagues who value good teamwork and professionalism in a varied daily routine.   These are permanent positions with 37 hours per week. Weekend and evening work are a natural part of the job.   Salary and working conditions are based on the collective agreement between the Ministry of Finance and the OAO and the organisation agreement for theatre technicians at the Royal Danish Theatre.       How do you apply?  Apply by 15 May 2022 at the latest by clicking on "Apply" to the right of the listing and attaching your CV, your degree certificate, and recommendations if applicable. You are also welcome to attach pictures of your previous work.   Send your application now, as we hold regular interviews.   Anyone interested, regardless of personal background, is encouraged to apply.     Want to know more?  If you have any questions about the positions, you can email Nina Brødegaard Resch, Head of the Make-up and Wig Department, at nres@kglteater.dk.   Find out more about the Royal Danish Theatre here https://kglteater.dk/
